remarks.format: ## Remarks 装饰器是一个自定义，它绑定到。An adorner is a custom that is bound to a . 在装饰器层，这是基于经过装饰的元素或一套装饰元素，则始终是一个呈现图面中呈现装饰器呈现装饰器无关的呈现装饰器绑定到。Adorners are rendered in an adorner layer, which is a rendering surface that is always on top of the adorned element or a collection of adorned elements; rendering of an adorner is independent from rendering of the that the adorner is bound to. 装饰器通常使用位于装饰元素左上部的标准 2D 坐标原点，相对于其绑定到的元素进行定位。An adorner is typically positioned relative to the element to which it is bound, using the standard 2-D coordinate origin located at the upper-left of the adorned element. > [!NOTE] > 父级是呈现，不被修饰元素。The parent of an is the that renders the , not the element being adorned. > [!NOTE] > 放置在装饰器层中的任何内容将呈现在设置的其他任何样式的顶部。Anything placed in the adorner layer is rendered on top of the rest of any styles you have set. 换言之，装饰器始终以可见的方式位于顶部，无法使用 z 顺序重写。In other words, adorners are always visually on top and cannot be overridden using z-order.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 装饰器可能需要不同于其修饰的元素转换。An adorner may need to be transformed differently than the element it decorates. 例如，装饰器的作用像点，如调整大小图柄，应进行转换和旋转以及经过装饰的元素，但不是应进行缩放。For instance, adorners which act like points, such as resize handles, should be translated and rotated along with the adorned element, but not scaled. 与此相反，在元素上显示字幕的装饰器可能需要与装饰元素相同的转换。By contrast, an adorner that displays a marquee on an element might require the same transform as the adorned element. 调用此方法由关联提供机会筛选不需要或不需要的转换。This method is called by the associated to provide an opportunity to filter unwanted or unneeded transforms. 此方法的实现应检查传入转换 （这是为经过装饰的元素的转换） 并删除不是有用或不应应用到装饰器本身的各个方面。Implementations of this method should examine the incoming transform (which is the transform for the adorned element) and remove aspects that are not useful or should not be applied to the adorner itself. 此方法还可用来添加其他转换详细信息在此时，例如添加转换，以使装饰器能够控制其位置相对于经过装饰的元素。This method can also be used to add additional transform details at this time, for instance adding a translation that enables the adorner to control its position relative to the adorned element.
